The open source driver is called "ati" and can be found in the "xserver-xorg-video-ati" pacakge
Thanks!! That's very helpful. Do I need to uninstall the restricted driver somehow first?
You can use the modprobe command to insert / remove modules (drivers) in the kernel.
for example: "sudo modprobe -r fglrx"
Removing the package will ensure that your system will choose the other driver at boot time though.
